title: [Large-scale] Project-Based Mathematics Education Design for HRD Professional Competency Development: Data Analysis and Decision-Making Modeling

context.prior_knowledge: Elementary mathematics knowledge (algebra, geometry, statistics) and HRD fundamentals, data interpretation skills: particularly equation solving, graph analysis, and probability calculation experience
context.additional_context: Aims to strengthen HRD competencies specialized in the mathematics domain (calculation, analysis, modeling), supporting learners in developing educational design skills (problem-solving, decision-support system construction) applicable in real corporate environments. The curriculum focuses on mathematical proofs and data-driven decision-making processes.

learning_goals: Strengthening competencies to analyze HRD job requirement-derived educational technology-based math content (statistics, probability, optimization): enhancing calculation accuracy, graph interpretation, and evidence-based conclusion-drawing skills.

Improving the ability to design customized math education projects (data visualization, predictive modeling) using LMS and tech tools: solving practical problems through equation-based modeling and probability distribution analysis.

Corporate managers/leaders, by the end of a 4-week course, select and apply three techniques (mean, standard deviation, correlation analysis) to real business data (sales, workforce efficiency, etc.) to create a decision-making scenario. They submit a report including formula proofs, graph interpretations, and three analytical conclusions, incorporating peer evaluations (3+ reviewers) and instructor feedback (2+ rounds). The report must achieve 4+ points (out of 5) in three or more rubric categories (clarity, accuracy, practicality, creativity), with statistical significance verification.

resources: Industry-specific case database for HRD job task analysis
Mathematics instructional design templates and tools
Access permissions for online collaboration platform (LMS)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
